alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 9:19PM CDT until May 11 at 4:26PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. At 30.0 feet, State Highway 216 affected. Extensive acreage near Harris Brake Lake and the Wildlife Management Area are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday afternoon to a crest of 29.6 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 24.7 Thu 7 PM 25.2 27.2 29.4 29.6 1 AM 5/09 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
